title: Experienced Associate - Strategy, Risk & Compliance - TPRM [US Client]
description:
Experienced Associate - Strategy, Risk & Compliance - TPRM (US Client)

Line of Service: Advisory

Industry/Sector: Not Applicable

Specialism: Cybersecurity & Privacy

Management Level: Associate

Job Description & Summary:

At PwC, our people in risk and compliance focus on maintaining regulatory compliance and managing risks for clients, providing advice, and solutions. They help organisations navigate complex regulatory landscapes and enhance their internal controls to mitigate risks effectively.

As a risk management generalist at PwC, you will provide advisory and practical support to teams across a wide range of specialist risk and compliance areas.

Driven by curiosity, you are a reliable, contributing member of a team. In our fast-paced environment, you are expected to adapt to working with a variety of clients and team members, each presenting varying challenges and scope. Every experience is an opportunity to learn and grow. You are expected to take ownership and consistently deliver quality work that drives value for our clients and success as a team. As you navigate through the Firm, you build a brand for yourself, opening doors to more opportunities.

Examples of the skills, knowledge, and experiences you need to lead and deliver value at this level include but are not limited to:

  • Apply a learning mindset and take ownership for your own development.
  • Appreciate diverse perspectives, needs, and feelings of others.
  • Adopt habits to sustain high performance and develop your potential.
  • Actively listen, ask questions to check understanding, and clearly express ideas.
  • Seek, reflect, act on, and give feedback.
  • Gather information from a range of sources to analyse facts and discern patterns.
  • Commit to understanding how the business works and building commercial awareness.
  • Learn and apply professional and technical standards (e.g. refer to specific PwC tax and audit guidance), uphold the Firm's code of conduct and independence requirements.

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Assist territory engagement teams in performing vendor management, vendor assessment, and managed services in accordance with territorial reporting guidelines.
  • Perform activities that will include:
  • Preparation of vendor assessment reports which will include an analysis of the business profiling questionnaire and due diligence questionnaire of the vendor, review supporting documentation, performing research on the operations and other relevant information about the vendor/supplier.
  • Handling end-to-end vendor onboarding process involving timely collection of documents to properly onboard a vendor and support with the payment/invoice processing.
  • Assessment of compliance of vendors against set standards/controls, SOC and PCI reports, etc.
  • Communicating with the clients and vendors and getting clarification where necessary.
  • Assisting in the administrative requirements of the team.
Handle multiple tasks at the same time with detailed focus and good project management skills when managing workload and maintaining timelines.

Minimum Degree(s):

  • Students in Information Security
  • Level of English: Advanced

Knowledge Required:

  • Knowledge of information security concepts, risk and controls concepts and vendor onboarding.
  • Knowledge on IT controls (especially IT risks).
  • Knowledge of Internal Controls and Compliance.
  • Knowledge on Privacy, Governance and Reporting.
  • Knowledge of Information Security and Data Protection.
  • Correct Information Security Management.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at PwC without regard to ethnicity; creed; color; religion; national origin; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; marital; or any other status protected by law. PwC is proud to be an inclusive organization and equal opportunity employer.

Travel Requirements: Not Specified

Available for Work Visa Sponsorship? No

Government Clearance Required? No

Job Posting End Date:

About Us:

You know us. We want to know you.

Your career is just that; yours. You choose it. You live it. You make it happen. To get the best from it, you need the best opportunities. That’s why opportunities are at the heart of a career with us. Opportunities for you to grow as an individual, to build lasting relationships and make an impact in a place where people, quality and value mean everything.

title: Construction HV & TL Substation Elect
description:
• Full-time
Company Description

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects in over 119 offices in 50 countries worldwide.

Our team is dynamic, innovative and client-focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver. As a result our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world.

Job Description

Job Description:

The Construction engineer in HV and electrical substations is an HV Substations Electrical Engineer specialized in the design and construction of high/medium voltage electrical substations who will ensure that the work of the substation and high/medium voltage lines construction are carried out according to Country Electrical Regulations as well as covering of all requirements. He will oversee verifying that all EHS procedures required in the mentioned construction are fully complied with.

This is a 100% construction on site role.

Executive Summary

The process, managed by the Construction HV Substations Electrical Engineer, is to help simplify Substation and Transmission lines work and maintain the overall schedule.

The Construction HV Substations Electrical Engineer will work with the project cost management team to help the Project Manager and DCD PM management and control all cost-related issues encountered during the construction phase.

The Construction HV Substations Electrical Engineer works directly for the DCD Program Manager and in coordination with Consultant Construction Manager.

Responsibilities:
  • Conducting preliminary surveys of the site of Substation and Electric Lines construction.
  • Ensuring that all formalities such as permits, and clearances are obtained from Government Electrical Regulator entities.
  • Ensuring that all electrical permits and electrical Government requirements are accomplished where apply.
  • Ensuring that the Substation GC keeps project documentation in order and within the appropriate repository.
  • Taking part in the Substation project planning plan and give inputs regarding implementation.
  • Ensuring that Substation construction activity progresses as per schedule.
  • Ensuring that work MOPs for Electrical Substation and HVTL construction were implemented and followed as required.
  • Reporting to the DCD PM and Consultant Construction Manager regularly with updates on the Substation construction work.
  • Communicating with DC construction coordinators to ensure that coordination between DC construction and Substation construction are in order.
  • Communicate with Substation GC subcontractors and ensure that the project progresses as per schedule.
  • Manage Substation designers, architects, and suppliers to ensure that construction is going on as per schedule and within quality requirements.
  • In charge of the process of electrical Substation turnover to CFE.
  • Acts as Quality Control Supervisor related to Substation and transmission Lines part of the project.
  • Interact with MSFT Energy Team, as well as A/E designer and DCE Team as required for the project.
  • Represent MSFT as owner of the contract where apply.
  • Oversee construction and installation activities to make sure that the electrical infrastructure and associated civil works are delivered on time.
  • Supervise the connection of the TL/SUB to the facilities of the Datacenter. Coordinate and secure proper Commissioning process.
  • Interact as required with AHJ (not only utilities) or any entity involved in releasing the infrastructure RoW and trajectories.
Qualifications
  • Degrees and/or professional licenses in Electrical Engineering.
  • Strong Verbal and Written Communication Skills in Portuguese and English.
Experience/Skills/Education:
  • 3+ Experience in Substation and electrical transmission lines standards and practices.
  • Good ability to effectively communicate complex technical solutions and concepts to engineers.
  • Experience in Electrical Transmission, Distribution Government AHJ Codes and rules.
  • Construction Health & Safety knowledge.
Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

title: Auxiliar Administrativo
description:
A Oleoplan, empresa líder no setor de óleos vegetais, está buscando recrutar um profissional qualificado para integrar a equipe administrativa em sua unidade de recebimento de grãos em Estação Capão do Cedro.
Se você possui as habilidades e qualificações necessárias para desempenhar a função de Auxiliar Administrativo, e está em busca de oportunidade de crescimento profissional e aprendizado contínuo, gostaríamos de conhecê-lo (a).

Principais responsabilidades:

  1. Realizar lançamentos e conferências em geral;
  2. Prestar atendimento ao cliente;
  3. Realizar atividades ligadas à rotinas administrativas em geral;
  4. Elaboração de planilhas e relatórios;
  5. Prestar suporte à gestão.

Requisitos:
Ensino médio completo;

Perfil desejado:
  1. Habilidades em rotinas administrativas;
  2. Proatividade;
  3. Dinamismo.

Não perca a oportunidade de se juntar à OLEOPLAN e contribuir para o sucesso contínuo da empresa. Faça parte do nosso time! Somos movidos por energia! #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Inspetor de Qualidade (temporária)
description:
OBS.: Vagas temporárias para cobrir licença maternidade.

Requisitos : Ensino médio completo; Conhecimento básico em Excel; Conhecimento específico em Ferramentas Lean Manutacturing e Ferramentas da Qualidade; Residir em Pedreira ou Cidades próximas.

Responsabilidades: Dar suporte ao coordenador de processos e qualidade à possíveis soluções de problemas; Emitir e controlar os alertas de qualidade quando houver problemas internos / externos (clientes); Manter a organização e o controle de registros da qualidade ( planos de controle de recebimento, plano de controle de produtos, desvios, alertas ); Controlar e alimentar planilha de dados para controle dos processos; Relatar o acompanhamento dos processos de produção; Realizar a inspeção e a liberação de insumos, entre outras atividades.

Horário de Trabalho: 1° turno - Seg a Sáb: 05:20h às 13:40h (1 vaga) | 2° turno - Seg a Sáb: 13:40h às 22:00h (1 vaga)

title: Ajudante de Limpeza
description:
Vaga de Auxiliar de Limpeza em Ribeirão Preto / SPConheça um pouco da nossa proposta:

As principais responsabilidades do Auxiliar de Limpeza incluem a limpeza e manutenção da Loja Oficina Reserva - Ribeirão Preto, com revezamento de dias em cada unidade.

Requisitos:
  1. Experiência prévia na função de Auxiliar de Limpeza ou em posições similares;
  2. Conhecimento das técnicas adequadas de limpeza e produtos de limpeza;
  3. Boa capacidade de organização e atenção aos detalhes.
Detalhes da vaga:

Escala: segunda à sábado
Horário: 10h às 14h
Salário: R$ 800,00
Benefícios: Cesta (R$ 138,00) + VT

title: Agente de Captação Imobiliária
description:
Descrição do Trabalho
  1. Realizar Captação ativa e Captação Passiva.
  2. Irá atuar em região pré definida pela imobiliária e com o perfil de imóvel indicado.
  3. O captador deve garantir que toda a documentação do imóvel esteja em ordem, incluindo contratos de autorização para venda ou locação.
  4. Realizar uma análise detalhada das condições do imóvel e do mercado local é essencial para determinar o preço justo e as estratégias de marketing adequadas.

Remuneração: Salário fixo + Comissão a combinar.

#J-18808-Ljbffr
